revised_title: Inter-quaternary Distance and Ganglion-Blocking Activity in Bis-Quaternary Compounds: A Study on the Mechanism of Action
tldr: This study investigates the relationship between inter-quaternary distance and ganglion-blocking activity in bis-quaternary compounds. Two classes of these compounds are identified, with different blocking activities based on the size of the quaternary groups. The authors propose a mechanism of action for these compounds, involving the interaction with acetylcholine receptors in the synaptic membrane. The study provides insights into the development of more effective ganglion-blocking agents.
